messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1367
messages.msgSnippet: ... I m starting to thing potty training may be almost genetic .  My mother thought my sister and I potty trained early because we were naked most of the
messages.messageBody:
> I swear my dd "potty trained"
> early(according to others) b/c she
> was naked all of the time.
>
> Interested in others experience.
>

I'm starting to thing potty training may be almost
'genetic'. My mother thought my sister and I potty
trained early because we were naked most of the time.
I think mine potty trained early because they weren't.
Almost from the day they were born I noticed they
would pee or poop almost as soon as I took their
diapers off (often before I had a chance to put the
new diaper under them.) Just since this discussion
have I realized that that is probably why they always
went on the potty when I put them on. They were going
to go where ever because I took their diaper off and
they potty became a habit. But they probably would
have potty trained early no matter what I did because
it is sort of pre-programed that way for them. My
sister and I and our children all potty trained at
18-22 months - but my brother, who is adopted, didn't
potty train until he was about 3-3.5 and neither did
his children, which is what makes me wonder about some
sort of genetic connection.
Michele

http://www.natural-wisdom.com/
>>

Added it to my favs to read when I have time. I have seen this mentioned
before. Do you actually practice this daily. Just curious b/c I am very
interested. I swear my dd "potty trained" early(according to others) b/c she
was naked all of the time.

Interested in others experience.

NICKI~
